item.comment:
Very light wargame focusing on bombing raid during Battle of Britain. Very simple rules and quick gameplay makes it nice gateway to wargaming.
I like the way action points allowance system is introduced in the game and movement-after-shooting rule. They require bit of tactical approach and some movement planning. That part makes the game challenging and brings most fun for players. Pure random shooting rules make the game bit unpredictable, but even that is fine for that kind of game. What I really don't like is the fact that one unfortunate roll can decide on losing the game, as there's simply not enough time to counter it with tactical redeployment.
The game is fine for occasional play, especialy as the intruducyion to gaming hobby for children.

item.name: Abyss
item.comment: Played only once. Very nice artwork, but the game itself appears less challenging than expected. Like to give it second try, possible rating increase.

item.name: Achaja
item.comment:
Played prototype at Pyrkon Game Con.
The game of power and treachery, full of negative interaction between players, who are the leaders of political fractions fighting for the throne of deceased king. Seize the political control over most areas of the capital to ensure that you will rule the kingdom. It's the race with one winner, and winner takes it all!
Game is based on dice management, where dice represent your influences over certain areas of capital. The highest result controls the area. Surprisingly, rolling is very limited, instead you have a lot of possibilities (from cards and locations you control) to manipulate the results, both on your and your enemies' dice or even to reallocate dice from one area to the other.

item.name: Advanced Third Reich
item.comment:
Played couple of times in late '90-ties. I enjoyed the games very much although remember that they lasted rather long and a game itself was full of special rules.
Want to play to check whether the game is still entertaining.

item.name: Alhambra
item.comment: Very good family game, simple rules and quick gameplay. Although not the obvious first choice, but always well considered candidate for nice evening play.

item.name: Auf den Spuren von Marco Polo
item.comment: Score after one play, possible rating increase.

item.name: Blokus Duo
item.comment: Nice abstract game for two players.

item.name: Budowniczowie: Średniowiecze
item.comment: I liked artwork and simplicity of the rules. Expected quick, family game, but turned out to be prone to massive downtime when players start to calculate "the best option". Prefer to play as 2-player game, not recommend with 4 players.

item.name: Carcassonne
item.comment:
Yeah, I know, it's classic game. I know that it brought some innovative ideas to gaming world. I played it occasionaly several times, but I couldn't find it entertaining at all. I always had an impression that there must've been something missing in the rules, the game always seemed too easy. I tried to discover any in-depth, any hidden rule which would make the game more sophisticated and entertaining, but not succeeded.
This game is THAT easy and I cannot recommend it. There are so many better games, why to waste time on that particular one?

item.name: Cardline: Zwierzęta
item.comment:
Very easy rules which can be explained in a minute make this game an ideal candidate for party game. On the other hand it is good education game, not only for the youngest players. Nevertheless young players are attracted by the theme and high quality card pictures.
It's Timeline clone, although the replayability is a bit raised, as animals can be compared by three features: size, weight and life longevity. It makes them more difficult to remember.

item.name: La chasse aux Gigamons
item.comment: One of the best implementation of memory game. Very entertaining, as it introduces the possibility to influence the score of other player.

item.name: Colt Express
item.comment: Fast paced game with high negative interaction between players, as they are wild-west burglars who try to rob the train (and each other). Can be lot of fun, but only when everyone likes that type of play, each fighting another, taking a chance to steal the prize from the opponent.

item.name: Dice Brewing
item.comment: One of the biggest dissapointment in 2015. I love dice management games so I was eagerly awaiting the possibility to play that one. Unfortunately the game did not get me at all, it is rather boring rolling experience, and dice management is incorporated in that way that you still have to roll higher result to make progress. Sorry, that time has passed already, now dice game have to be more sophisticated and bring some meaningful decisions on the table.

item.name: Dragon's Ordeal
item.comment: Another 'Talisman" clone. Nothing special and lasts too long.

item.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Fountain
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – The Pit
Exoplanets
item.comment:
First scoring after prototype play. Create life on distant planets and complete hidden goals. They may change each round, but still you can decide which ones you want to keep.
Variety of decisions to be taken, as you can expand system with new planets, create life on existing ones, or even grow it to create species for more points. But keep in mind that you have to stay focused on your goals, as the time is limited. The central star of the system grows old and its energy (yellow markers) is depleted each player's turn.

item.name: For Sale
item.comment: Pure bidding game, not my preference.

item.name: Formula D
item.comment:
It is very difficult to find perfect balance between 'speed' and 'simulation' aspects in racing games. Formula D makes it very good, proposing quick gameplay, but with enough opportunities to make tactical decisions during the race.
Basic game mechanism is luck-driven, as dice rolling is involved, but you roll different die depending on which gear your car is currently driving (e.g, on 2nd gear you can roll results between 2 and 4, while on 4th gear possible results are between 7 and 12). In addition players have possibilities to influence the result (like braking, which uses up your brakes) or take the risk(like taking the turn with high speed, which uses up your tyres). In the advanced mode the player can also prepare the car before the race to suit the driving habits, on the other hand weather can influence the race, forcing players to change tyres in pit-stop.
Although simplified, I found all racing aspects nicely included in the game in a way that makes the race quick and competentive enough, while sufficiently managable. Solid racing game, indeed!!!

item.name: Formula D: Circuits 1 – Sebring & Chicago
item.comment:
Two additional tracks are nice add-on to Formula D possibilities. This time you can find two american tracks, Sebring - where famous 12-hour race is held, and fictional Chicago track, aimed for street racing.
With this package you can also find additional rules for crossroads and jump over unfinished bridge, which adds flavour to your street racing experience.

item.name: Fun Farm
item.comment:
Another clone of jungle speed, this time mainly for the youngest players. Roll a dice and catch an appropriate animal before the other player will do that.
Nice game to teach eye-hand coordination.

item.name: Gears of War: The Board Game
Generalship : from the 4th century B.C. to the 19th century
Guns & Steel
item.comment: Nice idea and potentialy good title, but it suffers from not enough playtesting, I guess. When the player misses the opportunity to buy a card from certain era, he is out of the game. It is almost impossible to catch up with other players at that moment, especialy because you are easy prey for their stronger attacks, while avoiding them is impossible as the attack is always against all the players around the table.

item.name: Hej! To moja ryba!
item.comment:
Too many hungry penguins are around! You have to be quick and get your fish before it goes as a prey to other hungry bird. Make sure that you secure your hunting ground so no one will be able to catch your snakcs, and you will be rewarded with plenty of tasty fish.
Nice family game which suprised me with the number of tactical and planning decisions you have to make. Basicaly it's about dividing a shared area in that way, that my part will bring me more profits.

item.name: Herosi
item.comment:
Scoring after just one play and only basic rules involved. Did not have a chance to compose my own army of monsters.
What I liked in the game is real-time experience. It brings tactical game to a new level where downtime problems does not exists. If you think too long you are simply dead. But it has downside as well, as the game does not give a chance to make decent combo of cards. Instead it turns into fast rolling challange to activate your own dragon before your opponent will do the same. I have a feeling that all other cards are simply not relevant.
Need some more duels to make a final verdict and decide on scoring.

item.name: Horror w Arkham
item.comment: Was rated 9 before. Lot of high quality components and Lovecraft horror theme boosted my enthusiasm. But after several dozen of games, appeared to be schematic and tiring, mainly because of long gameplay and rather complex game rules. Like to play occasionaly, but only when in right mood.

item.name: Horror w Arkham: Koszmar z Dunwich – rozszerzenie
item.comment:
Very good expansion, which bring the Arkham Horror experience to new level. Now you have to defend not only Arkham itself, but also nearby village of Dunwich. Travelling between two maps takes both time and money two distant locations divide investigators and makes their cooperation harder. Additionaly special rules for monster called Dunwich Horror require special attention from the investigators.
Since the release of that expantion I always play Arkham Horror with it. A 'must have' for all game fans!

item.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Exp #1 – Fire and Ice
Krosmaster: Arena – Percimol Rules Expansion Pack #3
Labyrinth: Sciezki Przeznaczenia
item.originalname: Labyrinth: The Paths of Destiny (second edition)

item.name: Last Night on Earth: Growing Hunger
Last Night on Earth: The Zombie Game
Magia i Miecz: W kosmicznej otchłani
Mały Książę: Droga do Gwiazd
item.originalname: The Little Prince: Rising to the Stars
item.comment: Haven't seen the film but definitely this game is not linked with the famous book. It is just loosely coupled with it sharing a bit of dream-like atmosphere. The components are of high-quality and the overall appearance is intriguing, but the gameplay is neither challenging nor exciting enough to keep players focused.

item.name: Monsters and Maidens
item.comment: Small dice game, lot of rolling and some fun. Quick gameplay makes it good as filler or rolling entertainment during friends' meeting.

item.name: Monsters and Maidens: Epic Dice
item.comment: Brings additional twist into M&M game, yet makes it more complicated, as you have to follow different rules for rerolling each die. Bit puzzling, yet worth incliding into basic game.

item.name: Munchkin
item.comment:
Rules are simple and easy to learn. Expected fast gameplay, but the game lasts too long.
Not my style.

item.name: Osadnicy: Narodziny Imperium – Każdy Potrzebuje Przyjaciela
item.originalname: Imperial Settlers: Why Can't We Be Friends

item.name: Pokój 25
item.comment:
The game contains several modes of play (solo, coop, team vs team, coop/traitor) which was very appealing to me. So many diversity in one box! Good, have to try!
Turned out into a bit of dissapointment, as solo game is boring and unplayable, and standard coop is waaay too easy. However I liked both traitor and team vs team modes, which both play smoothly and bring a lot of fun for parties involved. Secondly, I had also an impression that originaly the game included more content which was split for marketing purposes into two parts (original game and add-on).
Therefore final rank pictures my doubts towards the title, half of the content playable, yet entertaining. Should the box contain also add-on material, I'd rank it much higher, for now it's solid 6!

item.name: Posiadłość Szaleństwa: Polowanie na Czarownicę
item.originalname: Mansions of Madness: Season of the Witch

item.name: Posiadłość Szaleństwa: Srebrna Tabliczka
item.originalname: Mansions of Madness: The Silver Tablet

item.name: Przebiegłe wielbłądy
item.comment:
This is not a family game, rather bidding one. It is not even fun when playing for the first time. Hard to say what makes it boring, perhaps huge luck factor which is beyond control of the players.
Initial rank 4 ______________________________________________
I decided to give it a second try, but it was even worse that the initial one.
Rank lowered to 3

item.name: Robinson Crusoe: Przygoda na przeklętej wyspie
item.originalname: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island

item.name: Small World: Grand Dames of Small World
Tibet
item.originalname: Tal der Abenteuer: Die Schatzsuche im Himalaja

item.name: Ucieczka: Świątynia zagłady
item.originalname: Escape: The Curse of the Temple
item.comment: "Creme de la creme" of real time games.

item.name: Warhammer Quest
item.comment:
Ultimate dungeon crawl experience! Fight off hordes of monsters, avoid lethal traps, collect gold and become real hero! The game introduces "experiece points" system which allows your heroes to expand their abilities, while facing more and more deadly foes.
One of the first dungeon crawl games with miniatures, which is still playable after all these years. Excellent replayability ensures long lifetime for next years to come.

item.name: Warhammer Quest: Catacombs of Terror
item.comment:
An expansion that introduces some additional undead experience, while throwing the heroes against evil necromancer.
Excellent undead figurines (take a look on necromancer on the throne!) makes this expansion really unique!

item.name: Warhammer Quest: Elf Ranger
item.comment: My preferred choice of hero for WHQ. Can be played as fighter or fighter/mage, both possibilies very rewarding for the team.

item.name: Warhammer Quest: Lair of the Orc Lord
Wings of Glory: WW1 Rules and Accessories Pack
Wings of Glory: WW2 Rules and Accessories Pack
Wings of War Miniatures Revised Deluxe Set
Wings of War: WW2 Deluxe set
Władca Pierścieni: Gra Karciana
item.originalname: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game

item.name: Władca Pierścieni: Gra karciana – Khazad-dûm
item.originalname: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Khazad-dûm

item.name: Władca Pierścieni: Gra karciana – Martwe Bagna
item.originalname: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Dead Marshes

item.name: Władca Pierścieni: Gra karciana – Podróż do Rhosgobel
item.originalname: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – A Journey to Rhosgobel

item.name: Władca Pierścieni: Gra karciana – Polowanie na Golluma
item.originalname: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Hunt for Gollum

item.name: Władca Pierścieni: Gra karciana – Powrót do Mrocznej Puszczy
item.originalname: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Return to Mirkwood

item.name: Władca Pierścieni: Gra karciana – Starcie u stóp Samotnej Skały
item.originalname: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Conflict at the Carrock

item.name: Władca Pierścieni: Gra karciana – Wzgórza Emyn Muil
item.originalname: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Hills of Emyn Muil

item.name: Znak Starszych Bogów
item.comment:
What I liked about the game is the artwork, which is very good, although in majority already seen in Arkham Horror before. After first attraction it turned into dice rolling experience without any mood or challenge. The game is just too easy, and simply boring.
Not recommended alone. The Unseen Forces expansion brings the game a bit back into right track, but still I'd rather spend my time playing other games.

item.name: Znak Starszych Bogów: Nieznane Siły
item.comment: A "must have" addition to Elder Sign game. Unseen Forces makes the original game more challenging and brings it to area where cooperation between players might be an option. I cannot imagine playing ES without it right now, as it was just too easy.

item.name: Наместник
item.comment:
Certainly very interesting game, resembles me Splendor with much more strategical choices during play.
Initial rating after one play, subject to possible change after more games.
